title: Rihanna reveals it is her 'dream' to become a mother as she discusses her future family plans
text:
Rihanna has revealed that it is her 'dream' to become a mother one day.

The singer, 31, was recently asked whether she wants to have children, and she admitted she doesn't mind opening up about her family plans - although she understands why some women get 'defensive' discussing the idea of parenthood.

Speaking to Extra, she said: 'A lot of woman get very defensive. It's personal, it's our bodies, and of course it's our time, and it's not necessarily everyone's dream to be a mom... but it's mine, so I'm fine.'

Future: Rihanna has revealed that it is her 'dream' to become a mother one day (pictured in October 2019)

Rihanna has shown her maternal side in the past and often dotes on her niece Majesty, five, who she has posed with on the red carpet in the past.

The Diamonds hitmaker has been romantically linked with Saudi businessman Hassan Jameel for over two years.

While she has mostly kept her love life under wraps, Rihanna did revealed her relationship is going 'really well'.

She said: 'Yeah, I'm dating. I'm actually in an exclusive relationship for quite some time, and it's going really well, so I'm happy.'

Plans: The singer made the admission in an interview with Extra when she was asked if she would like to start a family one day (pictured with her niece Majesty, five, in September 2017)

The make-up mogul also told how she feels she has seen a 'shift' in her life recently and feels like she is maturing.

She said: 'I'm definitely feeling a shift. I'm growing up. There's things that I'm paying attention to that I've never paid attention to. 'Like supplements. And working out. And hearing about my bones.'

Meanwhile, Rihanna confirmed she had turned down the chance to perform in the coveted Super Bowl half time show in solidarity with Colin Kaepernick, whose take-the-knee protest at racial inequality saw him ousted from the NFL.

Romance: The Diamonds hitmaker has been romantically linked with Saudi businessman Hassan Jameel for over two years (pictured in February 2019)

She insisted she couldn't be a 'sellout' or 'enabler' by taking on the lucrative slot.

Asked if the rumours of her declining the show were true, she admitted: 'Absolutely. I couldn't dare do that.

'For what? Who gains from that? Not my people. I just couldn't be a sellout. I couldn't be an enabler.

'There's things within that organisation that I do not agree with at all, and I was not about to go and be of service to them in any way.'

Rihanna said: 'Yeah, I'm dating. I'm actually in an exclusive relationship for quite some time, and it's going really well, so I'm happy' (pictured in October 2019)

The star seems to have a lot on her plate as she recently opened up about her ninth studio album in the latest issue of Vogue.

In the magazine she called the forthcoming album 'reggae-inspired' before saying that it's all 'pending.'

Her visual autobiography called Rihanna, will be available on October 24.
